definition: see 胸有成竹[xiong1 you3 cheng2 zhu2]
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: But on the surface he looks calm and ready.
sentences.chinese: 但表面却异常平静，好象成竹在胸。

sentences.english: But on the surface he looks calm & ready.
sentences.chinese: 但表面却异常平静，好象成竹在胸。

sentences.english: Were you always confident a deal would be done?
sentences.chinese: 对于续约一事，你是否一直都成竹在胸？

definition: to plan in advance (idiom)/a card up one's sleeve/forewarned is forearmed
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence
grasp it and victory is assured/to have success within one's grasp (idiom)
to be well aware of sth/to understand clearly
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
lit. to devise battle plan in a tent (idiom)/fig. planning strategies
